fields.description:
Currently, even if Slack is disabled on an Instance (following [these steps|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-cloud-for-slack-956709523.html]]), Slack option would still be available on the User Menu:

!image-2020-02-28-17-31-09-525.png|width=175,height=272!

Admins would like the ability to remove this entry from the menu.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Images using the built-in size options in the old editor are not rendering the images correctly when viewing the page using the mobile web browser.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using the old editor;
 # Insert an image to the page and choose one of the default sizes available in the old editor (small, medium, large);
 # Publish the page and then, open it using a mobile web browser; 
 # Notice that the aspect ratio for the images using this default configuration will not be respected, making the images not render correctly. 

h3. Expected Results
The images' size should be respected and the image should render correctly. 

h3. Actual Results
The image is showing up distorted.

h3. Workaround
Use the pixel configuration to resize the images.
fields.summary: Images are not rendering correctly in the mobile browser for pages created using the old editor

fields.description: It would be great to have the option to start a numbered list with '0.' instead of only being able to start with '1.'
fields.summary: Allow '0.' to be formatted in a numbered list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the [new editing experience|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], when the user adds a bullet spacing in a bullet list and does not add any characters to it, this will make the spacing to be ignored when the page is published.

Although it is ignored when published, in the edit mode of the page, the spacing will still bee displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page using the [new editing experience|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html].
# Tap the *Bullet list* icon located on the editor toolbar.
# Add something to the first bullet and then, hit Shift + Enter/return to create a bullet spacing. Do not add any content to this part.
# Hit Enter/return to create a new bullet point and add some text to it (this will help to locate. the bug)
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The bullet spacing should it should remain when the page is published.

h3. Actual Results
Although the bullet spacing is preserved in the edit mode, when the page is published, it is not preserved, like in the example below:

When in edit mode:
!Edit.png|thumbnail!

When the page is published:
 !Published.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Add a blank space to the bullet spacing.
fields.summary: Adding bullet spacing without content will not be preserved when a page is published

fields.description:
In the [new editing experience|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], when a link from a different page is pasted, it will be converted to a smart card and will provide a better look to make it different from a simple link.

However, links generated by macros (e.g. [Children display|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/children-display-macro-724765170.html], [Page tree|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/page-tree-macro-724765260.html], [Content by label|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/content-by-label-macro-724765178.html]) will be represented a text including a link and no smart cards will be used, making it be different from the other internal links. The difference can be seen in the example below:

!differences.png|thumbnail!

This is a suggestion to have. the links generated by macros to become smart cards as well. This can help in terms of consistency between how the links will be used for the pages.
fields.summary: Convert links generated by macros to smart cards in the new editor

fields.description:
The macro has the intended behaviour where it *shrinks the table headings* when there is a lack of space to display the table.

In edit mode:
 !image-2020-02-28-20-09-19-900.png|thumbnail! 

In published mode:
 !image-2020-02-28-20-09-47-709.png|thumbnail! 

The macro should adjust the formatting in a way that it should not be distorted.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a page including images with effects (e.g. border, curl shadow, Drop Shadow) gets converted from the Legacy editor into the [new one|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], it converts the image, but, does not preserve any of the effects applied to it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to have a created page using the Legacy editor.
# Edit the page and tap the *Insert files and images* button on the editor toolbar > *Upload files* to add a new image.
# After having the image added, tap it and use the *Border* button or *Properties* > *Effects* and select an effect.
# Save the configuration and *Publish* the page.
# In a Confluence with the [self-service page-level opt-in tool for migration of pages between editors|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-articles/How-we-roll-out-the-new-editor-in-Confluence/ba-p/1204966#toc-hId--474930211], tap the *Preview* button and then, *Convert page*.

h3. Expected Results
The image should have the configured effect applied to it.

h3. Actual Results
The effect is not preserved.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Converting a page from the Legacy to the new editor removes the image effects

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Vendors would like to be able to render static content macros differently depending on whether the macro is viewed in view mode or editor mode. See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-65861 for the equivalent feature in dynamic content macros.

h3. Suggested Fixes

Provide a way for static content macros to have a Placeholder to show in edit mode, that way the ADF will be the same for both edit and view mode.
fields.summary: Provide a way for static content macros to know if they are in edit mode or view mode

fields.description:
It would be useful, to not cause more confusion among users, if the smartlink card that converts the URL of a page into the name of a page in the new editor, when restricted or if the users has no permissions to access that page, show a error message that the user has no permissions to access it or to request access to see it, likely as when the user has no permissions to see JIRA issues.

The error for "this is a restricted page" only shows when the users tries to access that page.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Charts Macro needs an Application link to Jira in order for it to load. However, the System (Cloud) based application link takes precedence. Meaning, if there are two application links:

# System Jira (Cloud)
# Server Jira

Users that cannot access the system Jira (Cloud) because they are not authorized to or there are not any licenses available; when attempting to use the Jira Charts Macro are not able to. 

The macro does not load and the DEV Console will show a 401 error to the application link that the user cannot access.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence site
# Add free Jira with Max of 10 users
# Add application link to an existing Server Jira
# Try and load Jira Charts with a regular user that does not have access to Cloud Jira


h3. Expected Results

Jira Charts should load because the user has access on a different Jira Instance

h3. Actual Results

HTTP Status 401*Unauthorized error - Along with the App Link ID that is refusing the connection

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Charts Macro not working

fields.description:

fields.description:

h3. Actual Results
 * Click on the headings doesn't navigate to the required heading paragraph

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the Google Drive for Confluence (Official) add-on, if the user is logged to the browser with an account without access to the embedded document, this user won't be able to access the document even if the correct account is used on the instance/ macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a document on google drive and share it with a specific domain/ company
# copy the document's link
# install the [Google Drive for Confluence (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213092/google-drive-for-confluence-official?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] add-on
# Paste the link to a page and publish it
# Login in the browser (in chrome the feature is called person/ people) with a different account from another domain
# Login to the macro with the right account (the one that has access)
# Try to access the document through the page

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to open the document

h3. Actual Results
Document won't open with the following message:
{quote} Your access has expired
Reload this document to gain access. If you still don't have access, contact the document owner.
{quote}

Alternatively, the following message is displayed as well:

{quote}
Signed out
You have been signed out. You must sign in again to save changes to this file.
{quote}

h3. Workaround
Use the right account to login in the browser using the person/ people feature:
- [Share Chrome with others \- Computer \- Google Chrome Help|https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/2364824]
fields.summary: Google Drive macro can't open document if the account logged on the browser has no access

h3. Expected Results

The multiple users should be added in the share list.

Only the first user added is being displayed in the share list.

Using complete mail address instead of selecting user from suggestion list allows to list multiple users.

{quote} * +*CONFCLOUD-6008*+
 * *CONFSERVER-6008*{quote}
 

This is the documentation that needs to be updated:
{quote} * *[Use Labels to Organize your Content|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/use-labels-to-organize-your-content-724764874.html]*

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The *[Refined Spaces Toolkit for Confluence Cloud|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216056/refined-toolkit-for-confluence-cloud?hosting=cloud&tab=overview ]* is breaking some of Confluence native features, letting the pages with the affected macros get shown as "_Unsupported Content_".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install this add-on;
# Create a new page;
# Click over the *+* button then *view more* and search for the *Page Tree* macro (using */* doesn't work, as the add-on makes all the options to be its own macro);
# Set the page you want to show;
# Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
The macro shows the page tree from the page you set in the macro.

h3. Actual Results
The page is set with *Unsupported Content*.

*Notes*: 
* Even with the add-on not being subscribed (only installed), the macros get a break;
* So far, we only identified the *Page Tree* macro breaking this way, but more macros could be behaving the same - we will update this request according to our findings.

h3. Workaround
Uninstall this add-on on *Settings > Manage Apps*.
fields.summary: Refined Spaces Toolkit breaks some native macros

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence violates the WCAG 1.4.1 when working with links/hyperlinks across the application.
By using colors to define different types of text, Confluence prevents users that have low vision to determine whether that is a link or just a colored text (as these users usually use the magnifier and not a screen reader).

h3. Suggestion
Highlight links in Confluence in a different manner, letting them blue, but also with the underscore, for example.
fields.summary: Underlined links for WCAG 1.4.1 compliance

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
- In the new editor, when the column header text alignment is set to center, the header height gets doubled. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
#  Create a new page
# Add a text in the column header
# Set the text alignment to center or right
# Click outside the table

h3. Expected Results
- The header height should not change when setting the column header text alignment to center. 

h3. Actual Results
- The header height should get doubled when setting the column header text alignment to the center. Clicking outside of the table will change the correct header height.

*Notes*
* This is affecting only the editing experience: once you publish the page, everything is set as expected

h3. Workaround
Place the mouse cursor before the first cell header and then press the left arrow key. Once you do this, click out of the table and keep editing your page (the bug will be presented again if you select the table).
fields.summary: Centered and Right Text Alignment of a Column table header is not working properly

h3. Issue Summary

When creating a space that using a key that is already taken by existing restricted space, the space key checker will not work, misleading admins. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 !create space.png|thumbnail! 

 # Create a space with Name *Lets Go* and spacekey *LG*
 # Restrict the newly created space, remove the view access to all groups and users, including admins.

The space key checker should return the error message *A space with this space key already exists.*

fields.description:
h4.Use case
Confluence parent pages used as documentation pages
Child pages contain document content in excerpts
Excerpt Includes are used to get the content into the documents
One excerpt can be used in multiple documents so you have a single source of truth

h4.Current state
Confluence cloud doesn't have a "link to excerpt" button in the excerpt include editing dialogue

h4.Desired workflow
Edit the document page
Click on the excerpt include you want to edit and
Click on a link to bring up the excerpt page in a new window
Edit the excerpt on the excerpt page with the new information
Save and close the excerpt page
Return to and publish the document page to see the updated content

h4.Notes
This workflow used to exist in Confluence server 5?

h4.Rational
This workflow makes it much easier for internal teams to find the content they need to update when working on a document page.
It is especially important when the excerpt content is used in many different document pages since the excerpt may not be a child page of the current document page.

h4.Consequences
When users can't find the excerpt content easily they tend to delete the excerpt include and put their content directly in the document page. This deletion means the child excerpt content doesn't get updated, and any other documents that reference this content won't get updated. You also loose your single source of truth.

h4.Workaround
Add the page link to the excerpt

h4.Downside
People often forget to add the link to their excerpt content
Also, the excerpt includes are no longer clean so document pages can no longer be sent to customers until the excerpt links are removed
fields.summary: Ability to redirect/ link the excerpt page.

h3. Issue Summary

Currently, we cannot share a blog with Groups, but the UI still says _Enter name, group, team or email ._

Also, when trying to share a page to a group, the members of the group are not receiving mail notifications.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

For Blog Post
 * Navigate to blog post
 * Click on Share

For Page share
 * Open a page and click on Share .
 * Type the name of group and click send.

h3. Expected Results
 * No option to share with Group
 * Members of the group should receive mail notification for shared page .

h3. Actual Results
 * Option to share with the group, but no notification is sent.
 * The mail notification is not being received to any of the members in the group.

h3. Workaround
 * Share the blog post or page with Teams to send a notification for a certain number of users.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing search analytics in Confluence Premium, some search terms don't reflect full words (e.g. "ab" "peo" "tec" etc.) This is not reflective of what people are actually searching.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Perform a search on iPhone/Android mobile apps, by typing the search term _slowly_
 # _(wait for the results to appear in search analytics)_
 # Open the Search tab in site-level analytics
 # Observe multiple search terms shown

h3. Expected Results

There's one search term tracked with it's relevant statistics.

e.g. project plan
h3. Actual Results

The search term appears multiple times in parts.

e.g. "p", "pr", "pro", "proj", "proje" etc.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Incomplete search terms in Confluence Analytics Premium

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * When editing the "Default Welcome Message" template, automatic link labels are not displaying properly when viewing the welcome message on <instance_name>.atlassian.net/wiki
 * Automatic link labels for pages work fine and default to wiki mark up

Example:
||Editing the template||Viewing template||
|!Screenshot 2020-02-19 at 22.57.10.png|thumbnail!| !Screenshot 2020-02-19 at 22.58.42.png|thumbnail! |
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to <your_instance_name>.atlassian.net/wiki
 # Edit the welcome message as shown below:
 !Screenshot 2020-02-20 at 08.37.26.png|thumbnail! 
  
 Copy/paste links to a page and a space

h3. Expected Results

The page and space labels remain identical in style
h3. Actual Results

The link to the space doesn't have a label whereas there is a link label on the page link
 !Screenshot 2020-02-19 at 22.58.42.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
 * Manually insert a link and populate the link and label fields(as per [Insert a text link)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/links-776656293.html#Links-Insertatextlink]
 !Screenshot 2020-02-19 at 22.58.08.png|thumbnail!
 * The link label should appear on the welcome message as expected
fields.summary: Welcome message doesn't support automatic labels for space links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The space overview page doesn't show a link to see analytics, like you can on any other page in Confluence. The metadata section and link is missing.
h3. Workaround

*Standard/Premium:* Open the 3 dots menu "...", and click the "Analytics" item to view insights on a space overview page.

*Premium only:* Click the "Analytics" link on the space sidebar to get an overview of the space. To specifically view activity on the space overview page, find it in the table inside the Pages tab and click it.
fields.summary: Add the analytics link onto the space overview page

fields.description: I like to scroll down and keep the text I'm reading close to the top of the page as I read long text. It's frustrating when I overshoot and have to scroll up a bit that the breadcrumb/share/edit bar comes down and covers the text I would like to read when I scroll up
fields.summary: Breadcrumb bar obtrusive when reading

fields.description: Allow admins to control if former users show up with actual profile picture and name or with hidden profile pic and name
fields.summary: allow admins to control former users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
An image inside of an expand macro won't be displayed on the mobile app

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Insert an image inside of an expand macro and publish the page
* Access the page through the mobile app

h3. Expected Results
The image should be shown upon expanding the macro

h3. Actual Results
The image is not shown


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior besides moving the image outside of the expand macro. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Images inside of an expand macro won't be shown on the mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When copying and pasting a list containing a styled text along with "-" and another word will paste the other word in a second indentation level. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create the following bulleted list:
{code:none}
* `lorem` - ipsum
* `dolor` - amet
* `donec` - purus
* *lorem* - ipsum
* *dolor* - amet
* *donec* - purus{code}
* Copy it and paste it again to the page

h3. Expected Results
The list should be similar to this this:
* {{lorem}} - ipsum
* {{dolor}} - amet
* {{donec}} - purus
* *lorem* - ipsum
* *dolor* - amet
* *donec* - purus

h3. Actual Results
The list will be similar to this:
* {{lorem}}
-- ipsum
* {{dolor}}
-- amet
* {{donec}} 
-- purus
* *lorem* 
-- ipsum
* *dolor* 
-- amet
* *donec* 
-- purus


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Copying and pasting a bulleted list containing styled text and "-" won't work properly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user inserts gadgets within a multiple-column layout, the subsequent gadgets are not displayed as expected. Sometimes the first one is smaller than expected, sometimes the subsequent ones are smaller.

This can be observed by either inserting the gadgets manually or by copy and pasting them.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page using the Fabric Editor (New Editor)
 # Insert a multiple-column layout
 # Insert a gadget inside the first column
 # Insert gadgets inside the subsequent columns

h3. Expected Results

All gadgets are rendered in the same manner
h3. Actual Results

The rendering is inconsistent

!image-2020-02-19-17-48-08-488.png|width=300,height=176!

!image-2020-02-19-17-48-48-363.png|width=292,height=141!

 
h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inserting non-Confluence Gadgets within multiple column layouts incorrectly renders the gadget

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users should be able to command/middle click settings icon in top nav in order to open the page in a new tab.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Command click has no effect on settings icon

h3. Expected Results

Admin settings opens in a new tab
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
n/a{noformat}
h3. Workaround

n/a
fields.summary: Admin settings icon in top nav should be a normal link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some images, such as with .png format copied (from another page, web or screenshot) and pasted on a new editor page are not being rendered correctly.

It sometimes render too big or too small on the page on published mode. On edit mode, it shows the image on size you want, but sometimes it not renders correctly and the is not resizable anymore.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create/edit a page on the new editor
 # Copy a small png icon image from the web and paste it on the page (or take a screenshot and crop the image and make it a small icon (between 128 x 128 or smaller) 
# Publish the page
# Edit the page again
# Click on the image/icon and try to resize it
# Click on the image and change its alignment (to left of right)
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The images/small icon keep the resize/size and align and render correctly on the page after publishing.

h3. Actual Results
The images/small icons are not being rendered correctly and sometimes it gets bigger or smaller after publishing the page.
If you click on them, on edit mode, it also changes its size and it is no longer possible to resize it if you don't publish and edit again.
Nevertheless, it does not render correctly. 

h3. Workaround
Use the legacy editor or upload the icon images as emoji.

h3. Notes:
.png, .jpg and .svg are currently being affected.
Sometimes, even images bigger than 128x are being affected, even though it was uploaded through the files and images option.
fields.summary: Images such as small png icons inserted/pasted on a new editor page are not resizing/rendering correctly

fields.description:
I would like to be able to place a button on a page or in a template that works like the "Create from Template" macro, but instead can be set up to create a specific type of Jira Ticket in a specific project. 

With "Create from Template" button, you can preselect the Page Template you want the button to use. With a "Create Jira Ticket" macro button, I would want to be able to select the issue type and project where the Jira ticket would be created. 

This would be a helpful feature since it would eliminate the need for users to know the full project structure of our Jira instance, and would guarantee they used the right ticket type for the request they are creating. 

We are pushing to have our employees interact with Confluence regularly, and this would be a great additional feature.
fields.summary: Confluence: Create Jira Ticket button like Create from Template

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some users have the [Bitdefender Wallet|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/bitdefender-wallet/gannpgaobkkhmpomoijebaigcapoeebl] extension installed in their browser and it causes Confluence to get frozen when we are editing pages.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install this extension in your browser;
# Create a page;
# Add an *Action Item*, for example, or edit it.

h3. Expected Results
The page works fine.

h3. Actual Results
It gets frozen and you have to kill the tab and re-open it.

h3. Workaround
Disabling the {{auto-form-fill}} feature in the extension settings may fix this issue.
fields.summary: Bitdefender Wallet extension makes Confluence to freeze

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we are looking at page history and are up to restore a version from a page, if the page in question is restricted to edit and you are not added in the restrictions, the *restore* button is gone and the *delete* one stays in the page, but nothing happens when we click on it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# With a user *A*, create a page and let it with editing restrictions for this user;
# Log in with a user *B* and access the page;
# Go to the page *ellipses (three little dots, in the right-top corner) > Page History*;
# Click over the *Delete* button.

h3. Expected Results
You shouldn't be able to delete or restore the page, neither see these options in Page History.

h3. Actual Results
Only the *Delete* button is shown and clicking on it does nothing.

*Notes*:
* The endpoint to trigger the delete of the page is {{https://SITENAME.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/CONTENTID/version/1}} and it returns the below message:
{code}com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.NotFoundException: ContentId cannot be found: 776700391{code}

h3. Workaround
Make sure to have *Delete* pages permission in the space, as well as to be listed in the page restrictions with *editing* privilege.
fields.summary: Restore/Delete page versions not behaving as expected when page is restricted

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When working with blog posts on Confluence, sometimes we want to let them restricted for some reason. Though, if another space admin needs to recover access to a restricted blog post, it is not possible, once blog posts don't get shown in *Space Settings > Permissions > Restricted Pages*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Blog Post;
# Insert any content within the page;
# Let this blog post restricted for you and publish it;
# Navigate to *Space Settings > Permissions > Restricted Pages*.

h3. Expected Results
The blog post is shown listed there.

h3. Actual Results
The blog post is not shown as a restricted page.

*Notes*:
* it is possible that the *Restricted Pages* is getting only content that is set as {{contenttype = 'BLOGPOST'}}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Blog Posts with restrictions don't show in Restricted Pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, there are no Edit Options for Page titles in edit mode, all the options are greyed out.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a way to edit the title using Options, for e.g. Add the title as Instructional Text.
fields.summary: Enable the options to edit Title Headers

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, we only support [NVDA|http://www.nvaccess.org/] with [Firefox|https://www.mozilla.org/firefox/] (on Windows) and [VoiceOver|http://www.apple.com/accessibility/osx/voiceover/] with [Safari|https://www.apple.com/safari/] (on OSX), as options for screen-readers.

h3. Suggestion
We could expand the support for accessibility by adding JAWS as one of the supported screen-readers.
fields.summary: Official support for JAWS screen reader
Improve warning message when creating issues from a draft page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Anyone wanting to us the upgrade touch point on copy space permissions can not do due to the modals stacking on-top of each other incorrectly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence instance and space
 # Edit the space permissions
 # Create a new space and follow the space creation wizard
 # Attempt to copy the space permissions from your existing space
 # When you come across the "Upgrade to copy permissions" modal click on "Try it now"
 # Notice that the modal (Up-flow modal) window which appears comes in BEHIND the already open one

h3. Expected Results

The Up-flow modal should appear ABOVE of the "Create a blank space" modal
h3. Actual Results

It appears BELOW the "Create a blank space" modal.

See attached screen shot.

Looking at the CSS applied the "Create a blank space" modal has a z-index of 3006 applied, which is causing it to appear above everything else in the product it seems (the Up-flow component has a z-index of 500 applied).
h3. Workaround

You can edit the CSS in dev tools - but a real user won't do this I don't think.
fields.summary: Up-flow modal on Copy Space Permissions Page is obstructed

fields.description:

fields.description:
Confluence could offer a feature for administrators to pull a report containing:
 * Pages created by a user;
 * Pages viewed by a user;
 * Comments posted by a user;
 * Pages edited by a user.

This would help administrators to measure Confluence usability.
h2. Workarounds

The "People" feature in Confluence lets a user see what pages another user has created, updated and commented on.
 # Click People in the Confluence navigation
 # Search for the particular user and click the user card
 # Click "View all" next to the "Worked on" section

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/searching-for-people-and-teams-976161203.html]

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/your-personal-profile-976161172.html]
fields.summary: Ability to pull a report for user statistics
Formatted hyperlinks doesn't work properly for Linkable Headings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
when clicking the + sign ("Create a child page") at the right edge of a different parent page navigation entry, the Create canvas doesn't appear until the mouse is moved away from the navigation entry. Sometimes it functions correctly, but at other times the bug appears consistently.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Click on a child page of any parent page.
 !image-2020-02-17-14-12-07-050.png|thumbnail! 
 # Step 2 Go to a different parent page and click on  + sign ("Create a child page") 
 !image-2020-02-17-14-12-55-428.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2020-02-17-14-13-16-056.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Create window(select template) should appear when be click on + icon

h3. Actual Results
Create window(select template)is not appearing when be click on + icon it appears when we move the cursor.

(i) It is an intermittent issue.

h3. Workaround

The issue appears only for the first time, try again to create page or move the cursor.
fields.summary: Button malfunction - Create child page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you impersonate a user and then access Confluence, when you need to switch back to your account, the button to do so performs no action and does not switch the account back. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Impersonate a user; 
 # Click on the "switch back" button in the impersonation flag on the top right side of the page; 
 # Notice that it will have no effect, or sometimes it keeps appearing after the switch back to the user.

h3. Expected Results

This button should take you back to your account. 
h3. Actual Results

You keep impersonating the user.
h3. Workaround

*For instances with both Confluence and Jira:* 
* Click on the application navigator button on the top left side of the sidebar and then change the product to Jira. The pop-up to switch back will appear again and you will be able to go out of the impersonated user account. 

*For instances with Confluence only:* 
* Log out from Confluence and then login back with your user account. 
* Navigate to <siteurl>/impersonate, which will reset the impersonate function. e.g. acme.atlassian.net/impersonate
fields.summary: Switch back to your account not working when in Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing a Confluence page using the new editor, if you have an expand macro on this and need to change its name/label, the page will scroll up/down automatically.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a page using the expand macro;
 # Try to edit the expand macro's label/name; 
 # Notice that the page will start scrolling when doing so.

h3. Expected Results

The page should not scroll up or down while editing the expand macro name. 
h3. Actual Results

The page is scrolling up/down when the expand macro name/label is edited. 

[^expand_macro.mp4]
h3. Workaround

Edit any other part of the document first, or simply click on the expand macro's body and then edit the label.
fields.summary: Editing the expand macro label while editing a page makes the page automatically scroll up/down

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When migrating from Server/Cloud to another Confluence Cloud instance, the task report macro doesn't change id for the pages on the new instance.
Instead, it still carries the old id for the page and doesn't reference the new page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert a task report macro on a page
 # Export the page/space as XML
# Import the page/space on another instance
# Go to the page where was inserted the task report macro

h3. Expected Results
The task report macro is updated and reference the new id of the page correctly, showing the macro as designed

h3. Actual Results
The task report macro does not update the id of the page inside the macro and still references the old id.


h3. Workaround
Change the id of the old pages in the former instance to the new page id in the currently instance and update it manually on the task report macro.
fields.summary: When migrating from Server/Cloud to another Confluence Cloud instance, the task report macro doesn't change id for the pages
Nested Page Properties Report in Page Properties doesn't work if space is set

fields.description:
In Confluence, if the user doesn't have the permissions or application access to JIRA, but only to Confluence,  they can't see the Jira issues as expected, however the error does not match the exactly reason for it. 
Instead, it is shown a generic error, which is not clear why the users is not able to see it.

This is a suggestion to improve the message for users who doesn't have access to the JIRA application, to clarify that this is a expected behavior error, due to permissions or product access.
fields.summary: Improve the error message for the JIRA macros for users with no application access for JIRA
Indented numbered lists should be continued with numbers instead of letters

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

We allow collaborative editing on Confluence, but we don't have a way to track/audit which changes are being made by which individuals.
 !Screenshot 2020-02-14 at 19.55.33.png|thumbnail! 
 The highlighting should be included in the page version and be marked when calling the page data using REST API
h3. Suggested Solution
 * Include user and date information(+ any other useful attributes/parameters) and the changes they made on a page
 * Allow that data to be called via REST API

h3. Why this is important
 * Customers may want to report on who is making which specific changes in Confluence
 * We allow collaborative editing but do not audit which user makes which specific changes

h3. Workaround
 * No known workaround
fields.summary: Page history should display which users made which specific changes on a page

fields.description:
I'd like to have several images in one line like it was easibly feasible in the old editor.

Using the new editor it's impossible to have several pictures in one line without any crazy workarounds like tables or columns which both have their backsides (grey borders or fixed width)
fields.summary: Multiple images in one line

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While performing a Space import from a cloud site to another cloud site, the attachments on the pages are displayed with their metadata information in the format like  /attachments/contentid/pageid/version
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a space and upload a few attachments on pages for Cloud site *A*
 #  Initiate a space export from cloud site *A*
 # Import the particular space on cloud site *B*.
 # Navigate to the imported space and respective pages
 # The attachments will be displayed in the above format.

h3. Expected Results

The file names should be displayed in thumbnail preview of the attachments
h3. Actual Results

The metadata shouldn't be displayed in thumbnail preview of the attachments
h3. Workaround

Re-upload the attachments in order to resolve their name correctly.
h3. Notes

The metadata references the contentid and pageid from Cloud site *A* (Source)  and storage format still includes the filename as shown in the attachment.

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

Portuguese is not available in Indexing language under Confluence general configuration

*Suggested Solution*

Portuguese(PT) should be there in the drop-down list of Indexing languages

*Why this is important*

Because the customer wants to see complete indexing in Portuguese

*Workaround* 
can suggest Brazilian (PT)
fields.summary: Portuguese (PT) language is not available in Indexing Language list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

* An empty banner appears when we cancel a personal space creation operation

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Click on Profile Picture
* Click on Add Personal Space
* Dialog Opens, Click Cancel

h3. Expected Results
* Dialog closes 

h3. Actual Results
* Empty banner appears.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Empty Banner while cancelling Personal Space creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
No matter the available space on the page, the livesearch macro will be too small on the  new editor, cutting the placeholder text.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with the new editor
# Insert a *livesearch* macro
# Select *large* size 
# Paste this to the placeholder text: "Search onboarding documentation"
# Save the macro and publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The macro should be displayed on the page the same way it's shown on the preview window

h3. Actual Results
The macro will be to short on the page, cutting the placeholder text.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Livesearch macro is too short on the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using collaborative editing (multiple people editing the page at the same time), when inserting contents inside of a table (or even in the editor itself), the editor sometimes will randomly repeat the characters, words or macros being inserted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page with a table along with multiple users
# Type some content into the table
# Use copy and paste to insert some text
# Use cut and paste to move contents within the table

h3. Expected Results
The contents should be inserted/ copied without problems

h3. Actual Results
Sometimes (it happens randomly), the contents will be repeated multiple times in the same cell or even creating new columns/ rows.


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Collaborative editing randomly repeating content inside of tables in the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a user [copies a page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/move-copy-and-hide-pages-724764858.html] using the Legacy editor, certain fields like the title, share/invite to edit and macro browser will not recognize keyboard inputs while in the edit mode of the copy.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(i) These steps must be performed with Google Chrome and Safari.
 
# Create a Confluence page. It must be in the Legacy editor.
# Use the *Copy* function on this page. The copy must be in the Legacy editor.
# Try to insert text to its title, the field to invite someone to edit, or, in the *Search* field of the macro browser (displayed after tapping *Other macros*)

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to add text to these fields.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing is inserted. The fields do not recognize the keyboard input.

*Additional details*:
# The following video has been recorded to demonstrate the phenomenon:
 [^Copy.mp4] 
# This will not happen in Firefox. The copy process will take a few additional seconds (and sometimes, have a glimpse of an error message), but, it will allow the content to be added.
# This does not happen in [the new editor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html].
# The user can copy and paste the content into the fields.
# In some cases, nothing happens when a user tries to click Save/Publish the copied page

h3. Workaround
Different options can help as a workaround:
* Refresh the page while in the edit mode.
* Publish the copy and edit it again. This will allow the fields to be edited.
* Use Firefox to create the copy.
* Copy and paste the text into the fields.
fields.summary: Copying a page with the Legacy editor will not allow its title (and additional fields) to be edited in Chrome and Safari

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While editing a page in the Fabric editor, if you select Preview from the page menu (ellipsis, top right), the page will display in preview mode, including an Edit button to return to editing. 
The edit button remains at the top of the page while scrolling through the content, but it has a z-index of lower than the body of the page, which means that it is inaccessible as soon as you begin scrolling.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page
# Preview the page
# Scroll down to the bottom of the page

h3. Expected Results
Edit button in Fabric editor preview mode is should be accessible when scrolling

h3. Actual Results
Edit button in Fabric editor preview mode is inaccessible when scrolling

h3. Workaround

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the old editor, make two headings:
 ## test
 ## テスト
 # Add a Table of Contents (TOC) macro and publish the page
 # Click each links

h3. Expected Result

Both links work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The panel that contains the file's name, options to download and edit the file, which is usually shown when opening an office attachment (word, excel, powerpoint) will be hidden if the page also has an office (Office Excel, Office Excel, Office Powerpoint) macro on the legacy editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page on the legacy editor
# Attach an office file
# Add an office macro (but don't remove the attachment view)
# Publish the page
# Click on the office file to preview it (click on the file, not on the macro)

h3. Expected Results
The top panel containing the file's name, options to download and edit the file should be shown

h3. Actual Results
There's no panel at the top of the file previewer

h3. Workaround
The available workaround is to either remove the office macro or use the new editor.
fields.summary: Title panel is not shown for office files if there's an office macro on the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you are inserting images by drag and drop on Confluence pages (new editor) from the browser or file and images upload, it will causes the other images uploaded in the page  to be replaced upon publishing the page by last image uploaded, if they have the same name and no errors are display like "an image with this title/name already exists".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a page
 # Upload an image using the Drag and drop from the browser or from file and images upload macro
# Upload another image with the same name
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The images are the ones you uploaded individually and are all on the page as expected.

h3. Actual Results
The images uploaded are replaced by the last image uploaded.

h3. Workaround
Rename the images before uploading into the page. If you are using drag and drop, you will need to download the image to make sure it isn't using the same name of the other images.
fields.summary: Files with the same name uploaded into Confluence pages, causes it to be replaced

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
if you add a Recently Created Chart Macro using the Legacy Editor, will make all the Inline comments disappear on the UI. Also, the button to create a new inline comment won’t appear anymore on the page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page using the old editor.
 # Add random text.
 # Publish the page.
 # Create an inline comment on any part of the page.
 # Edit the page.
 # Add a Recently Created Chart Macro on it.
 # Post the page.

h3. Expected Results
Inline comments that were already created should appear on the page. Also, highlighting text should generate a button to create a new inline comment.
h3. Actual Results
After the macro is added and the page is posted, the inline comments won’t display anymore and user won’t be able to create new ones.
h3. Workaround
Currently, the workaround is to remove the macro from the page. The existing inline comments will display again.
fields.summary: Can't view or add inline comments if the page has a Recently Created Chart Macro

fields.description: Currently, when formatting text in Confluence using the 'Code' option, the ability to add a link to that selected text is removed - it should be possible to link text that's also monospaced.
fields.summary: Monospaced text (formatted with the Code option) shouldn't remove the ability to add a link to that text

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 13 March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

As we're working through this feature and others, we wanted to address a lot of your concerns as to the future of the new editor and legacy editor.

Please read our recent community post here: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-Cloud-articles/Change-to-your-content-is-in-your-hands/ba-p/1324476

Thanks,
Avinoam

{panel}

h3. Description
If this issue already exists, please let me know and I'll be glad to kill this one and vote on that one instead.

In the old editor, tables can be set to "Responsive" or "Fixed."  The latter allows for specific column sizes and it's _almost_ what is currently available in the new Fabric editor.  I say almost because the old editor used fixed pixel dimensions for width while the new one uses percentage widths, perhaps in order to scale better on mobile devices.  In any case, while the "pseudo-fixed" nature of new column widths can be frustrating for many, it is not the issue I want to focus on here.

The Responsive version of tables in the old editor allowed for completely dynamic column widths.  The columns expanded as necessary to accommodate their contents.  Additionally, the table itself was only as wide as necessary to fit the contents of all the cells in all the columns.  This is not currently possible in the new Fabric editor's version of tables, and it limits the usefulness of tables (and wastes significant time by requiring manual updates to column widths after updates to content).

I realize that responsive tables can be performance-degrading in browsers, but this really is a useful feature, especially in smaller tables, where performance isn't as much of an issue.

For more discussion on this, see my original post here:

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/What-happened-to-responsive-table-widths/qaq-p/1020187|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/What-happened-to-responsive-table-widths/qaq-p/1020187?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=immediate_general_reply&utm_content=topic#U1299618]
fields.summary: Bring back the Responsive Tables option

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the Confluence new editor, it's no longer possible to set _any_ row or column to be a header. It was formerly possible in the legacy editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a table in the Confluence new editor.
# Select a row or column in the middle of the table.
# Select Table Options drop-down and select Header Row or Header Column.

 [^Recording #3.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
It's expected that the selected row or column would become the header.

h3. Actual Results
The selected row or column does not get changed into a header, it only toggles the first row/column on and off.

No current workaround.

h3. Issue Summary

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, the new editor basically works with links in a binary way:
* You can paste the link directly into the page;
* You can select some text/place the mouse cursor on the page and call *CMMD + K* to add the link.

When it is about links to Confluence pages:
* Pasting the link will enter it as *{{<ac:link>*}} in the HTML code of that page;
* Selecting some text/placing the mouse cursor in the editor and calling the link macro will generate an *{{<a href>}}* entry in the HTML code.

The difference between how the links to Confluence pages work here can provide us with a negative impact when we are exporting this page to HTML - links to Confluence pages that are not set as *{{ac:link}}* won't be converted by the exporting process to links within exported HTML files but as weblinks.

h3. Suggestion
Change the way that Confluence reads links to other Confluence pages in a manner that it understands they should be {{*<ac:link>*}} instead of *{{<a href>}}*.
fields.summary: Improve how Confluence works with links in the new editing experience

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 13 March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

As we're working through this feature and others, we wanted to address a lot of your concerns as to the future of the new editor and legacy editor.

Please read our recent community post here: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-Cloud-articles/Change-to-your-content-is-in-your-hands/ba-p/1324476

Thanks,
Avinoam

{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

Users can't create a link to a heading that is inside a table (including the table header).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Page using the new editor.
 # Insert a table.
 # Insert a heading on the table (it can be either on its header on in the table body).
 # Publish the page.
 # Note that Confluence UI won't show the link icon, to get the header URL.

h3. Expected Results
 - On view mode, Confluence should display the link to the heading.

h3. Actual Results
 - Confluence UI doesn't show the link icon, to get the header URL.

h3. Workaround
 - You can create the URL based on the heading text, and it will work. The structure of the link is:
 *URL of the page + # + heading text (note that you have to use - instead of blank spaces).*

For example, the link for *Testing the header inside a table* would be:
 URL of the page#Testing-the-header-inside-a-table
fields.summary: Linkable Headings don't work inside a table on the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * When pasting the Jira link in Confluence page, no confluence page link is created in Jira Issue automatically.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Scenario 1:*
 1. Create a Confluence page 
 2. In the editor window, include Jira macro, add the Jira Issue and click insert.
 3. Publish the page.

The confluence page linked in the Jira Issue Page automatically.

*Scenario 2:*
 1. Create a Confluence page 
 2. In the editor, paste the URL of the Jira ticket
 3. Publish the page.
h3. Expected Results
 * The Jira ticket has the confluence page linked to the ticket automatically.

h3. Actual Results
 * The Jira ticket does not have the confluence page linked to the ticket automatically.

h3. Workaround

Add the Jira issue using Jira Macro to link the confluence page in Jira Ticket.

h3. Notes

No Jira link button appears at the top of Confluence Page.
fields.summary: No Confluence link in Jira when link is pasted in Confluence page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If the text inside of a table's column have any style other than "normal text" (heading 1, heading 2, and so on), the column won't be sortable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page on the new editor;
# Create a table and populate it with data
# Change the text styles of one of the column to Heading 1 (or any other heading style)
# Publish the page
# Try to sort that column

h3. Expected Results
The column should be sortable

h3. Actual Results
Can't sort the column
|  [^sorting_problem.mp4] |

h3. Workaround
Set the text to have the "normal text" style
fields.summary: Can't sort table column if the values are headings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Allow users to sort an attachment macro on view mode (as it was possible on Legacy editor) by clicking on its headers.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Confluence page using the new editor.
 # Add an attachment macro to the page.
 # Publish the page.
 # Note that you are not able to sort the table by clicking on its headers.

h3. Expected Results

Users can sort the table on the view mode by clicking on the table headers.
h3. Actual Results

Clicking on the table headers does nothing.
h3. Workaround

The workaround is to edit the page, edit the attachment macro and then edit the *sort by* and *sort order* fields.
fields.summary: Sort Attachments Macro on View Mode
